Gramophone IO module¶

This is the module that handles all the communication with the Gramophone device. Two different serial communication modules are available. QGramophone inherits QSerialPort from pyqt5, while SerGramophone uses the pyserial package for communication.

QGramophone¶

Inherits the QSerialPort form the pyqt5 package and signals out the received values.

A QT based interface for communicationg with Femto-Gramophone

class QGramophone.QGramophone[source]¶

Gramophone object for serial communication with the device. Emits read values as QT signals.

static find_grams()[source]¶

Returns a list of QSerialPortInfo objects that are Gramophones.

open(qport)[source]¶

Starts the communication with the device on the given port. Expects the port as a QSerialPortInfo object.

read_bytes()[source]¶

A function automatically called when there is serial data available for reading. Emits the decoded velocity data as pyqtSignals

SerGramophone¶

Uses pyserial for communication. Does not use signals, values can be read manually or in the background on a separate thread.

A QT based interface for communicationg with Femto-Gramophone

class QGramophone.QGramophone[source]

Gramophone object for serial communication with the device. Emits read values as QT signals.

static find_grams()[source]

Returns a list of QSerialPortInfo objects that are Gramophones.

open(qport)[source]

Starts the communication with the device on the given port. Expects the port as a QSerialPortInfo object.

A function automatically called when there is serial data available for reading. Emits the decoded velocity data as pyqtSignals
